qas.question: When did Plymouth's railroad station open for service?
Along with the Tamar Valley Line, what local train service operates in Plymouth?
How many regional MPs have argued for the importance of Plymouth's train service?
Trains from what network sometimes operate out of Plymouth's railroad station?

context: Plymouth railway station, which opened in <a0_0>1877<a0_0/>, is managed by <a1_0>Great Western Railway<a1_0/> and also sees trains on the <a4_0>CrossCountry<a4_0/> network. Smaller stations are served by local trains on the Tamar Valley Line and <a2_0>Cornish Main Line<a2_0/>. First Great Western have come under fire recently, due to widespread rail service cuts across the south-west, which affect Plymouth greatly. Three MPs from the <a3_0>three<a3_0/> main political parties in the region have lobbied that the train services are vital to its economy.
